intro: Monella angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf monella, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Monella angustifolia is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
